article.headline: Hartford 65, MD Baltimore Co 55
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Ryan Stys scored 17 points to lead Hartford to a 65-55 win over Maryland-Baltimore County Sunday. The win gave Hartford (11-16, 6-12 America East) the sixth seed and a first-round bye in next weekend's conference tournament. The Hawks will play third-seeded Northeastern Saturday in the quarterfinals. UMBC (7-20, 4-14) will be the ninth seed in the tournament. Hartford took a 13-12 lead six minutes into the game and never trailed the rest of the way. The Hawks went on a 9-0 run on the way to a 36-25 halftime lead. UMBC cut Hartford's lead to 46-43 seven minutes into the second half and to 55-54 with 3:38 remaining. Stys hit a layup to boost the lead back to three. Bo Taylor then was fouled while making a layup and completed the 3-point play. The Hawks led 60-54 with 1:55 remaining and hit 5-of-6 from the free throw line to ice the game. Besides Stys, three other Hawks were in double figures. Taylor and Aaron Cook both scored 12 points, while Charles Ford chipped in 11. Sean Regan pulled down 10 rebounds for Hartford. Kareem Washington led UMBC with 19 points.
